page.title: 19Rivers
page.content: There are two rivers in our section and they meet near Walkey farm at Burrowbridge. The river{Tone}which flows through Taunton meets the river {Parrett.}The banks have to be very high on the river Parrett because it is a tidal river. Two years ago the banks of the river Parrett had weakened and it tumbled down because it was too low. They are still repairing it. They are hoping to build a wall so that there can be a proper road beside the river. There are {pumping stations}to drain the water from the fields into the river. They pump the water into the river at low tide but when it is high they close the sluice gates to prevent the water from flooding the moors. The bridge at Burrowbridge is the last place you can cross the river until you reach the M5.
